lines.text:
[In a gradually increasing crescendo of emphasis, starting in a normal tone, ending in a near roar]
Red, let me ask you. Have you ever once, in your whole life, had one, single, solitary, original thought, that didn't bounce off from somewhere else? I mean, have you ever sat down, considered all the available information, weighed it all in your mind, sifted all the possibilities, discarded what you couldn't prove, sorted out what made sense, and came to your own, personal, original, Red McBride opinion?

[after a long pause]
Why would I go to all that trouble?
